result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan C. Huff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two.

DNA sample
Assessment, counseling, and treatment as deemed appropriate by the dept.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
INCLUDES 14CF518 & 14CM1152 (filed in 14CF518)

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:22 am 
INCLUDES 14CF518 AND 14CM1152. 
State appears by ADA Lance Leonhard; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Pauline Toulouse.  

WAIVER OF PRELIMINARY HEARING IN 14CF518. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 

PLEA HEARING IN 14CF518 AND 14CM1152. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
State moves to:
In 14CF518: Ct. 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 
PLEA: 
In 14CF518: Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 14CM1152: Ct. 1 (Obstructing an Officer/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: In 14CF518: Cts. 1 and 2>>SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2; DNA sample; payment of court costs. 
                                                                                                                          - CONDITION of probation on Ct. 1 ONLY: 1 year MCJ imposed and STAYED for rule violations. 
                           : In 13CM1152: Ct. 1>>SWH for 1 year probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2; payment of court costs. 
COURT finds deft is entitled to NO days sentence credit if revoked. 
COURT advises counsel to look into sentence credit and provide stipulation or set hearing if needed. 
Adj: 10:40 am
Status conference on September 8, 2014 at 09:10 am.
Preliminary Hearing on August 5, 2014 at 10:20 am.
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Pre-trial conference on July 7, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
